alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 3:39AM PST until March 10 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Highway 1 along the Garcia River in Mendocino County * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 AM PST, The Garcia River and tributaries will flood portions of Highway 1 when it reaches levels over 9 ft. The river is forecast peak at 10.3 ft at 9am this morning, and drop below 9 ft. by 9pm tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Highway 1 along the Garcia River - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
